q: What equipment do I need to start content creation?
a: Budget setup ($300-500): Use your smartphone camera, Boya BY-M1 lavalier mic ($25), ring light ($40), and CapCut for editing (free). This provides everything needed to start creating quality content.

q: Should I invest in audio or camera first?
a: Always invest in audio FIRST. People will forgive bad video quality but not bad audio. Clear, crisp audio keeps viewers engaged - fuzzy audio makes them leave. Get a good microphone before upgrading your camera.
source: The Golden Rule: Audio is Key section

a: Mid-range ($1000-2000): Sony ZV-E10 or Canon M50 Mark II camera ($700-900), Rode VideoMic GO or Blue Yeti mic ($80-130), Godox SL-60W LED light ($150), and DaVinci Resolve (free) or Adobe Premiere Pro.

q: What equipment do professional creators use?
a: Professional setup ($3000+): Sony A7 IV or Canon R6 camera ($2,500), Shure SM7B mic with Cloudlifter ($550), Aputure 120D Mark II light ($650), and Adobe Creative Cloud Suite. This provides broadcast-quality results.
Must-haves: Tripod or gimbal for stabilization ($50-300), U3-rated SD cards for 4K ($20-50), external SSD for storage ($100-300), and green screen for visual effects ($50-150).
Start with what you have (phone is enough), invest in audio first (lavalier or USB mic $25-130), add basic lighting (ring light $30-60), and upgrade camera last when content quality demands it.
